tool_description: This API allows developers to generate, scan, and parse barcodes. The /generate endpoint allows users to create barcodes in a variety of formats including Code 128, EAN-13, and QR Code. Users can also specify custom options such as scale, height, and file format. The /scan and /parseBase64 endpoints allow users to scan and parse barcodes from images. This API is built with Node.js and TypeScript, and is designed to be easy to use and integrate with existing applications. It's perfect for deve...
name: ia-img-code
title: ia-img-code

api_list.name: Generate
api_list.description:
text (optional): The text to be encoded in the barcode. If not provided, a random barcode number will be generated.
scale (optional, default: 3): The scaling factor for the barcode. This value can be between 1 and 10.
height (optional, default: 10): The height of the barcode in millimeters.
includetext (optional, default: true): A boolean value indicating whether to include the text in the barcode image.
textxalign (optional, default: "center"): The horizontal alignment of the text in the barcode image. Can be "center", "left", or "right".
The endpoint supports the following barcode formats:

'australia',

    'azteccode',

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ia-img-code.p.rapidapi.com/generate"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ia-img-code.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ia-img-code.p.rapidapi.com/generate"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ia-img-code.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
